body_html: @strubell @yaroslavvb FYI if you use py_func on a CPU tensor there's no overhead to copy it back and forth between tf and numpy in most cases (we only copy now if the tensor is not in column-order), and since numpy doesn't hold the gil during SVD you shouldn't see too much python overhead.
body_text: @strubell @yaroslavvb FYI if you use py_func on a CPU tensor there's no overhead to copy it back and forth between tf and numpy in most cases (we only copy now if the tensor is not in column-order), and since numpy doesn't hold the gil during SVD you shouldn't see too much python overhead.
body: @strubell @yaroslavvb FYI if you use py_func on a CPU tensor there's no overhead to copy it back and forth between tf and numpy in most cases (we only copy now if the tensor is not in column-order), and since numpy doesn't hold the gil during SVD you shouldn't see too much python overhead.
